title: 820-01958 water damage 5v
message:
water damage at usb u3200/100 area and near U9060.
PPBUS_G3H 12.2V
PPDCIN 5.2V
L6960 0V both sides..
PP5V_G3S 0V
PP3V3_G3H 0.1V
dont see any short

title: 820-01958 water damage 5v
message:
"L6960 0V both sides.."
You must fix this first.
If no short, post U6960 voltages; 11, 10, 13.

title: 820-01958 water damage 5v
message:
Check CHGR_EN_MVR.
If present, change R6960.
If not, change U7000.

title: 820-01958 water damage 5v
message: CHGR_EN_MVR 0v  on r6960

title: 820-01958 water damage 5v
message: Just in case, before replacing U7000, check its basic voltages: P_IN, AUX_DET, VDDA/P, SMC_RST_IN, A/BMON.

title: 820-01958 water damage 5v
message:
P_IN 0.1v
 AUX_DET 0v
VDDA/P 5.1V
PPDCIN_G3H_CHRG_AMON 5.1V
didnt find  SMC_RST_IN but maybe is CHRG_RST_IN 0V

title: 820-01958 water damage 5v
message: i was replaced anyway the U7000 but the same..

title: 820-01958 water damage 5v
message:
"P_IN 0.1v"
Why changed it, if is not even powered up?

R7020 is broken, or it doesn't get DCIN_G3H at all?

"didnt find  SMC_RST_IN but maybe is CHRG_RST_IN"
Correct guess; but strange mention, as you already found other internal U7000 signals, above mentioned.

title: 820-01958 water damage 5v
message:
R7020:
PPDCIN_G3H-5V
SMC_RST_IN 5V
CHGR_CSI_P 5V
CHGR_CSI_N 5V

title: 820-01958 water damage 5v
message: Still P_IN and AUX_DET not present???

title: 820-01958 water damage 5v
message:
AUX_DET 1.2V
P_IN =  PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR_AMON - 5.2V

title: 820-01958 water damage 5v
message:
Check diode mode to ground at  CHGR_EN_MVR.
If still missing, change U6903; it may kill the signal because of internal failure.

title: 820-01958 water damage 5v
message: change U6903? you mean U6960?

title: 820-01958 water damage 5v
message:
Yeah, sorry; it is U6960 in this case.
Once removed, check  CHGR_EN_MVR; before soldering new one.

?

You've did something wrong to kill PPBUS_G3H.
Check diode mode on it now.

Next, check U7000 basic voltages...

Also check G3S and SSD voltages.

title: 820-01958 water damage 5v
message:
Possibly damaged T2.
Any liquid sign on the audio board/flex?

title: 820-01958 water damage 5v

message:
u6500 area was with water damage..

title: 820-01958 water damage 5v
message:
Did you follow all the steps in DFU tutorial?
If you can't enter DFU, there is a problem with T2, its communication with U3200, or USB-C lines.
Supposing all AWAKE and SLPS2R (T2 power lines) voltages are good.

title: 820-01958 water damage 5v
message: o.k, i was lift U3200 and U3100 and under both of the was corrosion! so i was clean and replaced(from donor board) now i get 20v but A puls from 0.03-0.00 and with battery is 20v a0.3-a0.0

title: 820-01958 water damage 5v
message:
Inspect USB-C terminals for corrosion.
Check diode mode to ground on their data lines also.
